ai-sn18:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn18:1.1.3_0: Then venerable Rāhula went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn18:1.1.3_2: While sitting on one side, venerable Rāhula said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-sn18:1.1.4_0: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
ai-sn18:1.2.2_0: Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:1.2.4_0: “But if they're impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn18:1.2.6_0: “But if they're impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn18:1.2.7_0: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn18:1.3.11_0: “But if they're impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn18:1.3.13_0: “But if they're impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn18:1.3.14_0: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn18:1.4.1_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye ... ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn18:1.4.1_1: They grow disillusioned with the ear ...
ai-sn18:1.4.1_3: They are repelled by the tongue, repelled by tongue, repelled by tongue-consciousness, repelled by tongue-contact,
ai-sn18:1.4.1_4: They grow disillusioned with the body ...
ai-sn18:1.4.1_5: They grow disillusioned with the mind,
ai-sn18:1.4.2_0: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
ai-sn18:1.4.3_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn18:1.4.4_0: (The ten discourses of this series should be treated in the same way.)
ai-sn18:2.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with sights ...
ai-sn18:2.1.11_2: They are repelled by smells, repelled by smells,
ai-sn18:3.1.9_0: Is mind consciousness permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:3.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind contact.
ai-sn18:4.1.9_0: Is mind contact permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:4.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with eye contact. ...”
ai-sn18:5.1.3_0: Is feeling born of eye contact permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:5.1.9_0: Is feeling born of mind contact permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:5.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with feeling born of eye contact, ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact. ...”
ai-sn18:6.1.3_0: Is perception of sights permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:6.1.9_0: Is perception of thoughts permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:6.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the perception of form ...
ai-sn18:6.1.13_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn18:7.1.3_0: Is intention regarding sights permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:7.1.9_0: Is intention regarding thoughts permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:7.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with intention regarding sights ...
ai-sn18:8.1.3_0: Is craving for sights permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:8.1.9_0: Is craving for thoughts permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:8.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with craving for sights ...
ai-sn18:9.1.3_0: Is the earth element permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:9.1.9_0: Is the consciousness element permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:9.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the earth element ...
ai-sn18:9.1.11_1: They grow disillusioned with the water element ...
ai-sn18:10.1.10_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form ...
ai-sn18:10.1.10_3: They are repelled by choices, repelled by choices,
ai-sn18:10.1.11_0: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
ai-sn18:10.1.12_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn18:10.2.4_0: the aggregates are the ten elements:
ai-sn18:11.1.2_0: at one time the Fortunate One was dwelling near Sāvatthī,
ai-sn18:11.1.3_0: Then venerable Rāhula went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn18:11.1.5_0: Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:11.1.7_0: “But if they're impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn18:11.1.9_0: “But if they're impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn18:11.1.10_0: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn18:11.1.18_0: “But if they're impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn18:11.1.20_0: “But if they're impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn18:11.1.21_0: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn18:11.1.23_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye ... ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn18:11.1.23_1: They grow disillusioned with the ear ...
ai-sn18:11.1.23_3: They are repelled by the tongue, repelled by tongue, repelled by tongue-consciousness, repelled by tongue-contact,
ai-sn18:11.1.23_4: They grow disillusioned with the body ...
ai-sn18:11.1.23_5: They grow disillusioned with the mind,
ai-sn18:11.1.24_0: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
ai-sn18:11.1.25_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn18:11.1.26_0: (The ten discourses of this series should be treated in the same way.)
ai-sn18:12-20.9.8_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn18:21.1.2_0: Then venerable Rāhula went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn18:21.1.2_2: While sitting on one side, venerable Rāhula said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-sn18:21.1.3_0: “Sir, how does one know and see so that there’s no ego, possessiveness, or underlying tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli?”
ai-sn18:21.1.4_0: “Rāhula, one truly sees any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: *all* form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn18:21.1.5_0: Any kind of feeling at all ...
ai-sn18:21.1.7_0: Any kind of choices at all ...
ai-sn18:21.1.8_0: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: *all* consciousness—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn18:21.1.9_0: That’s how to know and see so that there’s no ego, possessiveness, or underlying tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli.”
ai-sn18:22.1.2_0: Then venerable Rāhula went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn18:22.1.2_2: While sitting on one side, venerable Rāhula said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-sn18:22.1.3_0: “Sir, how does one know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and well freed?”
ai-sn18:22.1.4_0: “Rāhula, when one truly sees any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: *all* form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self,’ one is freed by not grasping.
ai-sn18:22.2.1_0: Any kind of feeling at all ...
ai-sn18:22.2.3_0: Any kind of choices at all ...
ai-sn18:22.2.4_0: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: *all* consciousness—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn18:22.2.5_0: That’s how to know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and well freed.”
ai-sn18:22.3.7_0: The Linked Discourses with Rāhula are complete.
